summary: This bill, the "Respect Parents’ Childcare Choices Act," reauthorizes the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. It amends the Act to increase funding, prioritize parental choice in childcare provider selection (including relative caregivers), and update definitions. The bill also removes provisions related to sectarian activities and revises non-discrimination clauses. It includes provisions for a pilot program to prevent fraud and another one to promote relative caregiving, and repeals the tax credit for expenses for household and dependent care services.
